extra.source: U.S. Census Bureau: Geographic Terms and Concepts

name: Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA)/Consolidated Metropolitan Statistical Area (CMSA)
description: Metropolitan statistical areas are CBSAs associated with at least one urbanized area that has a population of at least 50,000. The metropolitan statistical area comprises the central county or counties or equivalent entities containing the core, plus adjacent outlying counties having a high degree of social and economic integration with the central county or counties as measured through commuting.
